title: Helen Mirren praises Victoria Beckham after the pair's reunion at Fashion Week
text:
Helen Mirren has praised designer Victoria Beckham for being 'kinder' with her sizes so she can finally fit into her fashionable looks.

The actress, 74, told Lorraine Kelly on Thursday that she's 'never been able to fit' into any of Victoria's designs until recently, after she delighted the Spice Girl, 45, with an appearance at her London Fashion Week show last month.

Helen also joked that she managed to get a 'tiny smile' out of the famously pouted star when they posed together at her catwalk show.

Scroll down for video

Sensational: Helen Mirren has praised designer Victoria Beckham for being 'kinder' with her sizes after the pair met at London Fashion Week last month

Glamorous: Last month the actress famously wore one of Victoria's looks to her catwalk show at London Fashion Week (pictured)

Speaking about the fashion show in question, Lorraine noted that Helen wore an 'amazing dress' from Victoria's range.

The Oscar winner then gushed about Victoria's designs and her decision to be more relaxed with the sizing.

She said: 'I don’t go to a lot of fashion shows. I do love them when I go but I love Victoria as a person.

'She’s just the greatest girl. She’s a lovely, fun, great mum. I got a little tiny smile out of her in that photo of us together. She’s such a darling.

Candid: Helen was a guest on Thursday's Lorraine when she praised Victoria, explaining she previously couldn't fit into any of Victoria's designs

Sweet: She said: 'I’ve never been able to fit into them. Now she’s changing and I think she’s being a little kinder. I’ve been a big admirer of her clothes'

As Lorraine noted that Helen wore a 'lovely snakeskin print dress', Helen added: 'I’ve never been able to fit into them. Now she’s changing and I think she’s being a little kinder. I’ve been a big admirer of her clothes.'

Helen then reiterated that she finds it vital to be 'comfortable' and 'feel like you' when she chooses her clothes for events.

The Queen star was a guest on the show to promote her latest role in the epic period drama Catherine The Great, which sees her play 18th Century Russian Empress over overthrew her husband the King to take power.

Wow! Helen was a guest on the show to promote her role in the Sky Atlantic series Catherine The Great, where she plays the 18th Century Empress Of Russia (pictured)

Speaking about her role in the Sky Atlantic series, Helen said: 'I know really great I never imagined it would happen.

'I was doing an interview they said “what part would you like to play” and off the top of my head I said Catherine the Great might be interesting”. I never imagine it would come to pass , she was an extraordinary successful women.

'She behaved very like a bloke. I had to think like a man, because men have no apologies.'

Superstar: Speaking about her love of fashion, Helen said that she doesn't attend many fashion shows, but she did enjoy meeting Victoria at her runway show

Sweet: Helen then reiterated that she finds it vital to be 'comfortable' and 'feel like you' when she chooses her clothes for events

Next month Helen will also appear alongside Ian McKellen in The Good Liar, which tells the tale of conman who has growing feelings for a woman he met online.

Speaking about the film she said: 'I did a play with him a long time ago and it’s about internet dating and older people internet dating.

'It’s a widowed women looking for love and she falls upon this man who is a scam artist. The twists and turns, it goes on from there.

'That was a fabulous experience to work with Ian again, an incredible honour.'

Unlikely: When asked whether she would consider reprising her role as The Queen in the Netflix series The Crown, Helen said she doesn't think it will happen

Busy: Next month Helen will also appear alongside Ian McKellen in The Good Liar, which is set to be released next month

Helen famously won an Academy Award in 2007 for her performance in The Queen, and despite fans hopes, she said it's unlikely she will reprise her role in the later series of The Crown.

She told Lorraine: 'I don’t think so. Claire I thought was brilliant, Olivia I know will be fantastic.

'I think it builds then into a much more interesting picture then someone just coming back if you know what I mean.'

Lorraine airs weekdays at 9am on ITV.
description: The actress, 74, told Lorraine Kelly on Thursday that she's 'never been able to fit' into any of Victoria's designs until recently and praised the Spice Girl for being 'kinder' with her sizes.
